website_summaries.verdict: Designed to push snow, so you can cut down on time and effort when clearing snow from sidewalks, driveways, and more.
pros: Does a good job pushing snow and ice out of the way thanks to the 30" blade that can tackle a wide path with minimal effort
Pushing it also puts less strain on the back compared to traditional shovels
cons: Scoop may bend when lifting heavy snow, so it works best for pushing it out of the way

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Functional Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this awhile back in preparation for winter and got to use it today. Shoveled my sidewalks and cleaned up the parking area. Snow removal was painless, just find your pitch and push away. Blade cut nicely and is very slick. Snow rolls off this shovel with ease, making for simple clean off. Sturdy handle and solid hardware. Overall this shovel was a good choice for the money and will likely serve me for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fleming

customer_reviews.title: This shovel is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Well, this thing is anything but lightweight, but that's not why I bought it. Actually I thought it was a simple aluminum shovel with a steel tip, it is in fact 1/8 inch steel, all steel and can shovel ice as well as snow. The handle is sturdy and I almost look forward to using it... almost. It should last a lot longer than any plastic or aluminum shovel. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs to shovel snow or ice. I've owned probably a dozen plastic and aluminum shovels and this may be the last one I buy.
customer_reviews.author: DARTH HAIR

customer_reviews.title: Worked So Well That I Bought a Second
customer_reviews.text: We live in Eastern Idaho and we have already gotten a lot of use out of this snow pusher. It is super durable and the snow just falls off the blade which helps with pushing a lot of snow. The handle is comfortable (I'm 5'9") for my size and it is lightweight for almost anyone to use. My kids have used it and have had no complaints. Update (Jan 3, 2018): I liked the first one of these so much that I bought a second so my kids can use one while I am using the other.
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: Not as tough as it looks - at least not for Southeastern snow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shovel because of the good reviews and the claims of rugged sturdiness. It works fine in fresh dry snow I'm sure, but not with the stuff we get in the Carolinas. I used to leave the snow on our steep downhill driveway for the kids to sled down for a day. The next day, shoveling was a serious workout, and the metal scoop wore like crazy -particularly in the middle! the edges also bent. I still have it after years of use, but it really looks sad. Photos of current state attached.
customer_reviews.author: criss

customer_reviews.title: Makes clearing snow a lot easier than a plastic shovel!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great snow pusher and way more durable than plastic. Keep in mind this is a pusher and not a shovel. It’s intended to push the snow out of the way not to pick the snow up. I have used it for multiple winters and it has worked great. I would recommend repainting the bottom of the shovel after every season used to prevent rust. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra money and get a metal shovel or pusher.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: love shovel BUT
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about the design of this shovel except for the strength of the steel used. The blade needs to stay thin so the weight does not increase, but the blade has to maintain its shape better. My shovel is replacing an identical one bought 4 years ago. ends rolled up, blade edge wearing back. My new shovel came well packaged but with corners already rolled up. (I'll bend them back and hope for the best). I suggest they study ASTM Steel grades and pick a stronger steel. The company does everything else better such as the GREAT Quality wood handle.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Great, strong shovel that cleans down to the surface.
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty shovel that scrapes all the way down to the surface (cement or asphalt) because of its weight. Tough ice takes a couple extra passes. I use this shovel for the serious snow cleaning, and a lighter plastic shovel for the snow scooping and tossing. The only thing that worries is whether the handle will stay attached with the little nails/pins they've used... I assume they have done some r/d and determined they are strong enough. I will update the review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: BP_75_WhiteSox

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shovel to push snow it is a little heavy but I'm sure that is for moving the snow. Received it a little damaged on the ends of the blade I'm sure that happened because of the weight of the shovel. Packaging could have been better they only used bubble wrap on the end of the blade. They should have used something more sturdy for protection of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Griego

customer_reviews.title: where has this shovel been all my life.. ...
customer_reviews.text: where has this shovel been all my life....I actually didn't use it much, because thankfully in NYC there hasn't been much snow....We recently had a snow storm in February, and I was able to finally use it....Wow...this made my life so much easier. Really durable, and literally made shoveling a walk in the park...Just push and go and your done. This shovel was able to go directly beneath the snow, picking up ice and saving time. I didn't have to keep going over the same spot over and over. Really well built and I'm thankful I made this purchase
customer_reviews.author: O. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shovel for driveways!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutley LOVE this shovel! It's as light & sturdy as you can get. It gets all the snow & even ice. This is the second season We've been using it now & are so glad we got it. For reference I'm 5'9" 130lbs. I have no problem doing our large driveway as well as our front & back porch. This shovel has kept its sharpness & feels like it'll be years until we'll need another. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Classic 70s snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: As a kid when I would shovel driveways for $$$, and I used shovels like this one. Strong metal, and configured so that the snow will fly out ahead of the blade with a strong push. Metal blade cuts between the pavement and the snow very well. Modern plastic shovels suck and break in the brittle cold, and cannot take hard work. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DJohnstone

customer_reviews.title: Solid shovel
customer_reviews.text: I was in the same boat as anyone who breaks their snow shovel in February...and that is you can't buy another one because the stores are all sold out. It baffles me that in February, I can buy a lawn mower, but not a snow shovel. Anyway, Amazon to the rescue. Good shovel. It really picks up the snow and I can chip away ice easily. I prefer metal shovels over the cheap plastic ones. My only real complaint is that it is a bit heavier than my last metal shovel. I know there is extra weight associated with metal shovels but this is probably the heaviest I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: droid owner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This was the second shovel I ordered, this time for my son-in-law in southern Minnesota. I really like the steel edge for scraping down to the asphalt or sidewalks, and the curve is good enough to plow the deeper snow. This one is a perfect width for handling, whereas a wider shovel would be too difficult to push.. I do recommend spraying the shovel with silicone spray to make it slippery in wet snow.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: *UPDATE*  Garant replacing
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE 2/14/2020 Emailed Garant directly at their website and they have replied back that they will replace shovel. Great to know that they stand behind their products. Handle broke off in shovel, but otherwise still like new. Used very little(maybe 8 to 10 times) and has been kept inside. The wood is very dry and brittle? I have reached out to Garant to see if they will replace handle. I will update this review when/if I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: D Lt

customer_reviews.title: It is way too heavy -- that might be Ok if it were durable and sturdy in snow and ice -- unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: What a mistake this was -- I cannot understand how this thing got any positive reviews. It is way too heavy -- that might be Ok if it were durable and sturdy in snow and ice -- unfortunately, it's just the opposite. After using it twice the blade started buckling. The steel blade bleeds rust all over the garage floor. There is just nothing good to say about this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow Pusher
customer_reviews.text: This shovel will probably last longer than I will. I just wish that I could activate the "automatic" feature, but I haven't been successful yet...... Maybe I could talk my wife into using it -- probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Oley

customer_reviews.title: solid and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Many of the complaints about this item related to its weight. However, its weight results from it being constructed from sturdy/useful materials. As a person originally from northern Minnesota, this is precisely the type of snow shovel I was looking for. If you want a shovel that is made for shoveling both small and large amounts of snow, this is the type you are looking for. If you are concerned about its weight, remember that it won't break when you lift lots of snow or dent as easily as the cheap plastic/aluminum models available at outlet stores. If you want a solid and reliable snow shovel, I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: honeste vivere

customer_reviews.title: best snow shovel to push the snow.
customer_reviews.text: I can not and will not lift the snow from my sidewalk and driveway. I had a similar snow shovel for the last 30 years and it was wearing out. I replaced it with this one and I am very happy. I can hold the D Ring handle and push the shovel down the driveway and the sidewalk. I can push it out to the street or off to the side if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Z.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This shovel has a heavy, steel plowing blade that lets me push the snow across my driveway. It gets all the way down to the pavement on the first pass, unlike the cheap plastic shovels I have. I still use the plastic ones to throw the snow I pile up with the new one. This shovel was described as having a wooden handle but it's plastic, and I was all set to complain about that but after two decent snowfalls it seems to be fine so far. I wouldn't recommend using this shovel for throwing snow - just pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: chris west

customer_reviews.title: Excellent; almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: A great gadget - didn't know such solidly made snow pushers were still made until a friend recommended this brand. Got one of each handle style, and glad to have both. Way too heavy to use a lifting shovel, so need to keep one of those nearby. This weight really makes scraping packed snow and ice easy. The big width not only limits slide-off to the sides, but also makes a smoother "ride" over rough surfaces. One complaint: the rear doesn't curve in quite enough. Unlike a snowplow, even moderate amounts of snow just roll over the top. Still extremely useful, though, and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SeaWalnut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pusher / not for lifting snow (unless looking to build-up bi-ceps or get hernia)  :)
customer_reviews.text: Not a shovel to lift.........VERY heavy w/ no snow on blade to lift. Definitely just use as pusher for small snowfall to make piles and use standard snow shovel to lift & remove snow. Clearly a "hefty" item meant to last for years.........probably leave to kids when "go to the place in the sky" (if they know what it it and how to use it). Does NOT have a wear strip on leading edge (as it would add even more weight to shovel )!! Thick gauge steel NOT like the plastic crap being sold out there !!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Woozie

customer_reviews.title: Works great, heavier than I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my dad, 85 yrs old, who loved his old metal pusher which broke last season. Gave to him, but I used it first at his house to clear a well tromped upon sidewalk and his driveway. It ate that snow and ice up, right down to the concrete. Unfortunately, that workout proved it would be a bit heavier than his old shovel, so it wouldn't work for him. Shovel works great, just bit heavier than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Blueliner

customer_reviews.title: Steel is real!
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious snow shovel. The 30" blade is 6 to 10 inches wider than the average shovel. It's STEEL and it's heavy. I am happy to not have to use an aluminum shovel that bends so easily or a plastic shovel that is easily damaged. I expect this shovel will last for many years. It's a good value in my opinion given the strength and quality of the product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel Rick

customer_reviews.title: Say Hello to my Little Friend.
customer_reviews.text: This shovel does a number on the snow we get, especially <4". The trick is to clear ~12-16" at a time, and work downhill so gravity helps you. Couldn't recommend it enough; get the 24" version if the 30" looks too unwieldy. It's completely rejuvenated my love of winter and shoveling snow. As with any steel abrasive product, it does rust, so plan accordingly--a small price to pay for being able to race my neighbors and their snowblowers for pennies on the dollar--and bail them out when the snowblowers blink first!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Really better than plastic one! Saving 15 minutes this morning for shoveling! Not that heavy for women and relieved my backache! I wanted to buy a wider one but this arrived faster. Thanks for the good product!
customer_reviews.author: JoyLuna

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but effective.
customer_reviews.text: This shovel works great for clearing ice and icy snow. The only problem is it is heavy. I couldn't use it for pushing snow because of the weight. It is built very sturdy and should last quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Alice B.

customer_reviews.title: No Shoveling - Just Push.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. Unlike the ineffective plastic shovels and snow pushers being sold today, this is a heavy duty steel blade snow pusher. Your snow removal work is cut in half. There's no shoveling. All you have to do is push. I'm glad I purchased a 30inch blade because this is a heavy tool. A 36inch would have been too heavy. I was under the impression that I needed to assemble it and was plesantly surprised when Fed-EX delivered it already assembled. You will not go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: the 30 inch blade I bought is great. Snow shovels like these used to be common ...
customer_reviews.text: For light snowfall, the 30 inch blade I bought is great. Snow shovels like these used to be common in hardware stores years ago, but today I could only find them on Amazon. These are actually quicker than a snowblower for light snow. I also use it to move snow off to one side of the drive and then use the snowblower to move it off the drive. This snow blade, being as heavy as it is, is excellent for scraping off snow that has stuck to your drive. Buy one, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to be just as described when researching the tutorials. I am a 65 yo woman who does her own snow blowing and winter storm clean up. Product is very durable but not too heavy to push if one keeps up with the snow fall.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Printsky

customer_reviews.title: Good but bent
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy shovel. My came dented too. I got it on the Warehouse deals so just banged it out myself. I had the 24" before and it worked great and wanted a bigger one for the deck and patio..
customer_reviews.author: Allen C

customer_reviews.title: If you're very tall...
customer_reviews.text: Garant YSP30LU Yukon 30-Inch Steel Blade Snow Pusher Varnished Ash Handle I'm 6/4 and needed a longer handle than the 54.5" offered with the D grip handle of the Garant YSP30DU snow pusher or the 59.5" of this Garant YSP30LU. So, I bought a YSP30LU and a (made in the USA) Link Extra Large D-Grip Handle, from Amazon. You'll need to sand the handle end down round to 1.25" and cut the tip of the handle off, but the end result is a 65" long snow pusher. That's too long for the average person, but perfect for anyone well over six feet. The pusher, ash handle, and the Link D handle are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Victor H. Agresti

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have a long and fairly steep circled driveway and we get decent snowfall where I live. I had a smaller, similar version of this snow pusher and decided to get this one that's bigger. Good decision. Definitely helps clear the driveway faster and has held up to all kinds of snow and ice. Only issue is a tiny bit of curl in one corner after a year or so of use, but it's very minimal and doesn't seem to be getting worse. Overall, very good and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: A "REAL" shovel
customer_reviews.text: Ooooh look, a shovel made out of something real like STEEL!! Not one of those crappy "last for maybe one season if you are lucky" plastic or aluminum pieces of crap. ;)
customer_reviews.author: W. Dunham

customer_reviews.title: If you'll looking for more than Fluff!
customer_reviews.text: So tired of the cheap plastic shovels that can't remove ice from the walkways. Plastic shovels are good for the fluff, but for heavy snow and ice metal is the way to get the job done. The 24 inch shovel does most of the walkways with out an issue. Last year I bought the same in the 30 inch version which was a little too wide for many residential sidewalks. Heavy duty construction of steel and a good strong wooden handle, makes this a snow pusher that will handle the heavy stuff as well as the fluff. Thanks amazon and Garant.
customer_reviews.author: GSD

customer_reviews.title: Snow Pusher gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of replacing broken plastic shovels every couple of years. This shovel is the right size and weight to deal with heavier wet snow. Solid metal construction and a reinforced handle help to move several inches of snow at a time. It has proven to be an excellent tool in the first couple of snow storms.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Love plow style shovels, we rarely get more than 4 inches of snow where I live, this type of shovel does a great job clearing my drive way. It is well made and heavy duty, no plastic, a shovel your grandson can use long after you’re gone. High Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Greg R Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Shovel
customer_reviews.text: Hubby laughed when I ordered this off Amazon and the mail man cringed when he had to deliver. But let me tell you it clears an Alaskan driveway like butta!!! Finally a sturdy shovel. Tempted to buy another for a back up. So much better than a flimsy plastic shovel with an attached metal blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built for a lifetime of use
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews praise this for it's durability, heavy construction and strength. All true. Hard to find this type of product at a retail store. My only additional comment would be to strongly recommend the D handle on any shovel you purchase. Even though this is listed as a snow pusher, there are many times when you will want to lift the load at the end of the push to get the snow off the drive. The D handle makes this easier as it helps control any twisting from an imbalanced load. Great product that will last the average homeowner a lifetime. Literally.
customer_reviews.author: Pippin

customer_reviews.title: Super-sturdy -- Snow doesn't have a chance.
customer_reviews.text: It's got some weight to it, so expect a workout. But this is so much nicer than the plastic almost-toys that seem to be the only shovels in the stores these days. The scoop is all metal, with reinforcing braces up the handle. The curve on the scoop is just right, so the snow/slush rolls up and forward, making it so you don't have to lift so much. This shovel was designed and made for business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazed on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: A Really Good Snow Pusher / Shovel
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet because it's summer and 90 degrees out; however, this looks to be as good of quality as the one I have had for almost 20 years. The blade is actually worn down an inch or more from all of the snow shoveling! This shovel is great for pushing snow instead of having to lift and throw it. Since I have retired to Tennessee and no longer live in Michigan, this shovel should last longer than me. I think I will leave it to my son who lives in Denver.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and weight for scraping off the walk or driveway.
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic pain and fatigue. If I was healthy this would not be a problem, for me it is heavy. I still love the way it works and help me get the layer of ice snow off the driveway. I set it down and pushed, the shovel did all the work and gave me a clean surface. It is hard to find a good shovel now days. I put this in the Great column. I let you know how it does in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Packaging impovement needed. But shovel great
customer_reviews.text: Shovel quailty great, could use fiberglass handle but still great, the only thing was the packaging , it came in a gigantic box, why. But ok . except delivery man very hard to carry. Box was open when i got it
customer_reviews.author: Pamela r cox-hein

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to have this on hand
customer_reviews.text: A great gadget - didn't know such solidly made snow pushers were still made until a friend recommended this brand. Got one of each handle style, and glad to have both. Way too heavy to use a lifting shovel, so need to keep one of those nearby. This weight really makes scraping packed snow and ice easy. The big width not only limits slide-off to the sides, but also makes a smoother "ride" over rough surfaces. One complaint: the rear doesn't curve in quite enough. Unlike a snowplow, even moderate amounts of snow just roll over the top. Still extremely useful, though, and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SeaWalnut

customer_reviews.title: Shovel power
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting through icy heavy snow that standard snow shovels could not touch. Highly recommended but be aware this shovel is very heavy, which is both a curse and likely necessary for breaking up ice. The weight is the only reason for not giving it a 5 star rating. This shovel was built to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: max9900

customer_reviews.title: but works wonderfully. Very sturdy and well crafted
customer_reviews.text: Our old steel blade snow shovel finally bit the dust after almost 30 years of use. Tried ALL over town to find a new one but no luck. Even on-line at local stores; no luck. Found this, although not as wide as our old one, but works wonderfully. Very sturdy and well crafted. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job to scraping as well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this one to replace the one we had for over 20 years and had worn down over time. Can’t find these in the stores anymore. Designed to push snow. Does a great job to scraping as well. Nice to have the full size of the shovel again to push more snow. Was packaged well and came in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality.
customer_reviews.text: My old shovel was aluminum with a steel blade. I wondered if this would be the same. When I got it, I realized the entire blade was steel. Wow, this will last forever. One thing though--the handle is too short for a "pushing" type shovel. I had to stoop down to push which takes away a lot of the convenience of pushing. So, I ended up getting another longer handle and replacing the original. I only deducted one star as it was my choice to do so. Great shovel, though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pick

customer_reviews.title: Great Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. high quality and works great if you use it correctly. If you want to push snow and get as close to the ground as you possibly can then this is the one. I would not use this shovel to dig myself out after a snow storm though. the heavy weight allows the shovel to stay low to the ground while still pushing everything out of the way with ease. My girlfriend tried it out and didn't like it because she was trying to use it like a scoop shovel instead of a push shovel. Use the right tool for the job and know what it is designed to do and you will love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchyx71

customer_reviews.title: Push snow real easy, no snow blower for light snow
customer_reviews.text: For light snow, using a snow blower isn't really worth it. Instead, just push the snow away Before I had this, I tried cleaning the driveway with 18" and then 24" plastic shovels to push/throw away the snow.. took lot of time Then I used this. Worth every penny However, proper snow blower can't be replaced if there is lot of snow Also, if you have a long driveway, it might require a shovel to remove the collected snow and then continue pushing the remaining snow
customer_reviews.author: Aviral M. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shovel I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've spent nearly all of my 40 years living in Wisconsin and northern Illinois, so I've shoveled a bit of snow in my time. Last fall my wife and I bought a house with a 150 foot driveway on a 30% grade. While the snowblower takes care of most of it just fine, I still needed something for handling the walkways and cleaning up the stuff the snowblower left behind. We'd been using a crappy plastic pusher and an aluminum/steel shovel, but it was just too much driveway. This does the trick beautifully. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: B. Heinz

customer_reviews.title: I ordered one online as I have been unable to find this shovel again in the local stores and it is way better than any plastic s
customer_reviews.text: Umm, it's a snow shovel and who loves to shovel? It is very durable as I already own one that was bought in a store at home. I ordered one online as I have been unable to find this shovel again in the local stores and it is way better than any plastic shovel. This metal shovel is very durable and take a lot of abuse and heavy shoveling. I have had my store bought shovel for several years and wanted to find another so the hubby can help shovel also as we have a large area to clear. Very satisfied with this product and highly recommend. This shovel will definitely move the snow and ice without bending or breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tom
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would like the grip on the end of the handle. After using the shovel, the end grip was better.
customer_reviews.author: tom campbell

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but very durable
customer_reviews.text: I had the exact same shovel but in aluminum for 10 years and only issue I had was the steel edge attached with rivets would wear through. I replaced the rivets twice but then the blade was getting more curved and I wanted the same shovel but more durable. This shovel is exactly what I had hoped for but did not realize it was much heavier and may be a factor for someone. It does not have a wear edge so I expect this to last a very long time since nothing to break-shear. As always Amazon shipped very well packaged and very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Flower Lover

customer_reviews.title: Solid pusher shovel. The best I have used.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pusher shovel. The handle is long enough for my 6'2" height. The angle of the blade is just right. It scrapes the driveway cleaner than any shovel I have ever used. This is one of those products that I wish I had been using for years. The weight is the price you pay for a strong design. The weight also helps keep the shovel on the ground for more effective scraping. This is not for lifting snow. I use a plastic offset handle shovel for lifting the snow off the driveway. I had been using another pusher shovel, a true temper I think, for several years. It was weak and hard to use in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: scwman

customer_reviews.title: it's HEAVY DUTY
customer_reviews.text: Every thing is good on this item..my wife though is too small to push it..it weighs half her body weight ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Broke in half
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this a few days ago and was impressed by the construction. It is quite heavy. I was using it to clear the driveway, and it was doing an excellent job of clearing snow that was packed down.....until the wooden handle snapped in half! I hadn't even used it for five minutes and it broke. I was not being rough with it at all. I am exchanging it for a new one, but since they are on backorder for 1-2 months, winter will be over by the time it gets here. Hopefully I just got a defective one, but for now, I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mezzy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but no "Steel wear strip"
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy shovel. Thankfully, it's not the kind used to scoop and throw, just push. Still, it seems very well built and will survive some harsh winters. The only reason that I would not give this 5 starts is because the description clearly states: "This model also features a steel wear strip for extended blade life." However, there is no such strip. That being said, I'm sure this will tolerate several years of being slid across concrete before it needs to be replaced. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: letsgetlayer1

customer_reviews.title: Great push shovel
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a lot this winter. Love how it rolls the snow up. Very heavy duty. Be aware it is pretty heavy, and it's strictly a push unit, but that's as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Maniac

customer_reviews.title: Makes Shoveling Easy
customer_reviews.text: We were able to use this the day after it arrived. We might not get to use it again this season but we definitely made the right purchase. We didn't even go shopping at our local big box store and decided on this particular shovel based on reviews. We didn't want Poly, we were looking for Steel, old fashion style shovel. It worked great and the 24" looked wider in person and made the job go quickly. In case you are wondering I did measure this and it is exactly 24". Good job Garant for the quality product.
customer_reviews.author: VB Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Garant Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: These are exceptionally well made and solid! It is the thickest and heaviest blade that I've ever seen on a snow shovel. The "D" shaped handle provides for great stability when pushing and lifting large amounts of snow. As an FYI, the shovel is quite heavy even without 24" of snow on the blade. My wife has to push only about half the blade width so it is more manageable for her. If you like well built quality, I'd highly recommend this shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Home Handy Man

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back and your time
customer_reviews.text: This shovel does a great job of quickly clearing my steep driveway due to the shape and width. The length and strength of the handle saves my back! Overall it's built well. I deducted one star because it started rusting fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan A

customer_reviews.title: Leave it to the Canadians to know how to manufacturer a great snow shovel!
customer_reviews.text: Made in Canada and it shows--this is a heavy duty shovel, well-made, with great design features for moving surprisingly deep snow cleanly. Off the UPS truck directly into 8" of new snow with no problems! The heft keeps the shovel down and the curl perfectly wraps the snow to the front. Ideal for driveways and walkways (and outdoor ice rinks). As a lift shovel it does a great job cleaning up the edges too.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly the lightest shovel out there, but for heavy, wet/icy snow, you don't want that anyway. Easily pushes wet snow and minor ice aside and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: David Wicks

customer_reviews.title: This is the best snow shovel I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best snow shovel I have ever owned. I would definitely recommend buying the 24 inch to go along with the 30 inch. In deeper snow it is really difficult to push snow. I like to make one pass with the 24 inch and follow through with the 30 inch to catch everything that was left behind. Great when you have two people.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: When it arrived I checked it out and liked it. He said that it did a great ...
customer_reviews.text: For Christmas our son wanted this particular shovel. When it arrived I checked it out and liked it. He said that it did a great kpb/ I ordered one for myself and it really does do a good job. We have someone plow or snow blow the drive-way, but I like it really down to the black top so I go out and push the rest to the sides. Don't pick it up as the shovel is heavier than any we have had. 77 and going strong. Maureen
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a STEEL snow shovel! This thing rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: Good luck finding a steel snow shovel anywhere else! I looked all over and could only find those plastic junk shovels. My old steel shovel finally broke at the handle last year after many winters and I was looking for a replacement. I should've saved time and just went to Amazon first. This guy is built strong and to last. I really like the handle at the end too my old one didn't have it and I really like it. Thanks for still making a great STEEL snow shovel
customer_reviews.author: Ron Betser Jr.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS SHOVEL!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Pushes snow just like a manual plow. I actually don’t mind shoveling now.
customer_reviews.author: B. Freed

customer_reviews.title: Shovel requires some muscle power
customer_reviews.text: Works well - moves lots of snow. If you’re not very strong, this might be too large for you, with heavy snowfall
customer_reviews.author: C J - Indianapolis

customer_reviews.title: Not just for show
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a joke, because my last name is also Garant, but I was pleased to find that it is a great tool! I've been using it all winter and it's great with light or heavy snow as well as ice. It's a little heavy, but I'm 66 and have no trouble clearing a large, double driveway. And the weight makes it easier to get the icy spots where someone has already driven over the snow.
customer_reviews.author: C L Garant

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty shovel
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY DUTY!! This is my 2nd one, they do wear out after a few harsh northern Michigan winters.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalitaa

customer_reviews.title: It's to heavy
customer_reviews.text: You think shoveling snow a pain, it's more back breaking with this shovel. I don't even use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: LarryG

customer_reviews.title: mr. plow
customer_reviews.text: you're definitely mr. big d when you come pushing through with this heavy duty bruiser. got a few n'or easters last year and this literal mini plow was a life saver. only hitch is that its not exactly pleasant when it snags on something below. but use this to move it around and a lighter plastic guy to get anything that remains and you're in business. this thing was such a breeze that i even felt inspired to help the neighbors out.
customer_reviews.author: Jing W.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Way to heavy . A little short also. This should have a fiberglass handle instead.
customer_reviews.author: rdkmco

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited to use this shovel when it arrived. It is quite heavy but I figured that would assist in pushing the snow. However, when I went to push just a few inches see fluffy snow, the shovel kept grabbing my asphalt driveway. It appears the metal leading edge is too sharp to glide along the surface of my driveway. I wanted to add that my driveway is flat so I figured this would work well. Very disappointed to say the least and would.not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Squid12

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I thought. Don’t use as much because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Garant snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: Prefer the 30” blade on the pusher snow shovel. I have always been happy with Garant steel shovels. Prefer using Garant shovels over using a snowblower. These shovel do a great job and leave a clean surface.
customer_reviews.author: rockhunter

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out and it works as advertised. Pushed snow easily. Only used once - so cannot give long term projection for durability. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: JK from OK

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shove EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best snow shove EVER! Got the shovel one day, and the very next day, SNOW CAME! Two inches, and not one bit stuck to the driveway, at all. The shovel stayed clean and dry. THAT's the best snow shove I ever got!
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the old one
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly the quality of the Garant steel shovel I purchased 5 years ago. Bought this one because the old one finally wore out. Returned it because of the decrease in quality
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hall

customer_reviews.title: A snow plow with a handle!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy, but boy, can it plow through the snow. Don't think you are going to actually shovel with it though, it is a pusher only, the snow slides off of it because the metal surface is slick. I'm not a large person, but I used this to push 5 inches off my driveway in nothing flat. Unfortunately for my husband, he had to come out and shovel the edges for me with a different shovel, but it was still quicker using this pusher. Great for a smooth surface, like asphalt, probably wouldn't want to use this on gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P.

customer_reviews.title: Durable metal pusher.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy metal pusher. Extremely durable, have used it in 2 snows more than 6 inches. Easy to push and clear snow off sidewalks and driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Comes assembled and ready to use. Price was reasonable considering the superb quality of this shovel. All the hardware and box stores in town only carried crap, plastic, disposable shovels. This is a lifetime quality shovel. Very happy with the purchase. ****UPDATED REVIEW This is my second winter using this shovel, and what a winter it has been. I have put this shovel through the works and it still functions marvelously. Couldn't be happier and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Works good but lets face it
customer_reviews.text: Works good but lets face it, who really likes shoving snow.... Also, comes in a ridiculous large box.... plenty big enough to send my wife to her mothers.... ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Joel Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shovel for pushing snow. The thin but strong steel blade gets under the snow & ice and cleans the driveway and walkways right down to the surface. It is heavy though. Use of a lubricant like silicon spray helps keep the snow from building up and sticking to the shovel, otherwise it is a back breaker to pick up the shovel at the end of a sweep. The 30" wide blade is efficient for clearing a lot of area but is not good for those tight places. Very pleased with the purchase. Shovel should last a long long time which will make the shovel's expense seem like a good buy in years to come.
customer_reviews.author: James E Deutschlander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: It was just delivered during the East Coast's major snowstorm. I cleared the entire driveway in record time. I'm actually looking forward to driveway being covered again so I can go play with my new toy.
customer_reviews.author: rodisi

customer_reviews.title: Blade is too soft
customer_reviews.text: The blade is simply too soft. My 125 LB bride was using this and the blade corners were turning up and the blade was bending. This occurred in a single use. I returned the product and received a full hassle free refund.
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: Get the 24-inch!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-constructed, sturdy device. It is not for casual snow removal. I used a 24-inch version for about 20 years before the tack-welds started breaking and rust took hold. Definitely better than the plastic stuff they sell at the big box stores. My mistake, this time, was moving up to the 30-inch blade. It's heavier and more difficult to control. It's fine for quick clearing of a very light skift of snow, but when there is any depth, it makes lifting the snow too hard ... the blade tips too easily to one side or the other, dumping snow where you may not want it. I'm just sayin' .....
customer_reviews.author: Tim Switzer

customer_reviews.title: great shovel
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered promptly like everything I order from Amazon Prime. It is a well built shovel. We bought it to clear our pond when it freezes for ice skating. Heavier shovels make the ice smoothier. With that said, it is heavy and we wish we had ordered a longer handle. Lot's of shoveling with a shorter handle make for a sore back. However, you just can't find things built this solidly anymore. I actually should give it five stars, because if I were a short person, it would be the perfect shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Heavy, but pushes snow well
customer_reviews.text: Tired of plastic and fiberglass shovels breaking, I got this. It worked well for end of year snow storms where I did not need to use snow blower. It will push the snow to edges well, but is not idea if you are used to throwing snow with a shove. It feels heavier than stated weight, but that is because weight is at end of pole. My wife hated using it because of its heft, but it will probably last a long time because of such heft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for northeast winters
customer_reviews.text: I have had this shovel for 2 years now. There is no rusting and it is the best shovel I have had. It makes shoveling a large driveway much easier. It is meant for pushing snow. It is extremely heavy and it’s not easy for me to lift to throw snow. I could not handle the winters here without this shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Megt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Handy Snowplow Kind of Shovel
customer_reviews.text: OMG It works like a mini snow plow. Of course, you are the engine. This tool serves a purpose. It's not for picking up snow and throwing snow over your shoulder. This is heavy. But it is just right for certain kinds of snow that can be hand plowed to the side. I surprised my husband with this tool. I see him using it. so, I know it helps in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I previously had the Garant 30" shovel and loved it until the blade curled and wore out to ...
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Garant 30" shovel and loved it until the blade curled and wore out to a point I could not stand it (several years). I decided to go with the narrower version this time. Used it for the first time today and it was wonderful with a sharp edge and easy to grasp handle. I won't wait so long next time to get a new shovel!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is a 'tank' of snow shovels. I needed something better than the common plastic snow shovels to use on the snow and ice that collects on the asphalt driveway -- at 9050 feet. So far I like it very much. Yes, it's a little heavy, which is just exactly why I bought it. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer C

customer_reviews.title: Good, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Shovel works great. It gets down to the concrete and clears away ice and slush easily. Only downside is it is extremely heavy. Our Colorado powder snow is not too bad with it, but when we started getting wet spring snow it became very challenging to lift.
customer_reviews.author: Seeking Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Save your back snow shoveling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel and wouldn't you know it, it snowed three days later. I used it today and was very pleased. Very solid it was last for many years of service. The handle is great and the supports holding the blade will prevent the shovel from bending. Other push shovls bought over the last 40 years bent. This will be my last snow shovel!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST shovel EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST shovel EVER !! We live in the Adirondack Mtns of New York where we get ALOT of snow & this shovel is GREAT for pushing it out of the way!! I highly recommend this one with the steel blade because it's just heavy enough to move ALOT of snow at a time & the snow doesn't stick to it !! We previously had bought the same shovel about 15 years ago and we're glad we found another one so my spouse & I can BOTH shovel & get it done in half the time!! Very sturdy & built extremely well... Thank You !! DJ
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solidly built shovel
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solidly built shovel. Only downside is awkward angle that blade is attached to handle, tilted more than other similar shovels I have used, making it more difficult to actually scoop any snow. Works fine to bulldoze snow off the end of driveway if snow isn't too deep/heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Receive the product Out of the box the thing was bent and seem very chintzy and flimsy told my husband I would send it back and he said not to bother I’ll just use it as back up not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great snow pusher
customer_reviews.text: This pusher really does the job with light snow. It pushes so much snow, that if the snow becomes wet & slushy, it can become too heavy to push around. I like this width as well. It is 36 inches as I recall. Perfect size for our entry walkway. Any wider would be too wide and could be too heavy to push that much snow around.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Brown

customer_reviews.title: This is what I call a snow shovel...
customer_reviews.text: Very robust shovel. I bought it for the Michigan winters. I tried it last week on an inch of snow and works quite well. It will probably feel heavy with larger accumulations, but if you are in decent shape, it will do for an additional work-out. The only minor issue is that it doesn't have a wear strip, but the metal is so thick that this shovel will surely last many seasons even without it.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Marquez

product_meta.title: Garant YSP30D Yukon 30-Inch Steel Blade D-Grip Snow Pusher-Blue
product_meta.description: Style:30-Inch Snow Pusher with D-GripClear away snow without having to lift it with the help of the Garant snow pusher. Its 30 in (76.2 cm) blade is made of a single piece of high-quality steel that allows you to push a large quantity of snow. This snow removal tool is equipped with steel reinforcements for increased strength and rigidity. Its varnished hardwood handle absorbs shock well. For occasional or professional use.
feature_bullets: Single piece high quality steel blade pushes a large quanity of snow
Equipped with steel reinforcements for increased strength and rigidity
D-grip handle easily accommodates a gloved hand

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars966 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
